metadata.Title: CVE-2018-25020 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The BPF subsystem in the Linux kernel before 4.17 mishandles situations with a long jump over an instruction sequence where inner instructions require substantial expansions into multiple BPF instructions, leading to an overflow. This affects kernel/bpf/core.c and net/core/filter.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-25020` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-166-generic - 4.15.0-166.174
linux-image-4.15.0-166-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-166.174
linux-image-4.15.0-166-lowlatency - 4.15.0-166.174
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-166-generic - 4.15.0-166.174
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-166-lowlatency - 4.15.0-166.174
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1118-aws - 4.15.0-1118.125
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-1018-aws - 5.4.0-1018.18~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-166.174').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1118.125').
